channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Late night host Jimmy Kimmel is abruptly pulled off after Kirk comments
item.description: Late night host Jimmy Kimmel has been abruptly pulled off the air by ABC. The sudden move follows conservative backlash to comments he made earlier in the week about the assassination of Charlie Kirk.

item.title: There have been films about Reality Winner. Now the whistleblower tells her own story
item.description: Trump says Russian interference in the 2016 election is a hoax. To Reality Winner, it's very real. The former NSA contractor went to prison after leaking a classified document on Russian meddling.

item.title: Is the Trump administration's attack on two Venezuelan ships legal? A lawyer weighs in
item.description: NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with lawyer John Bellinger about the legality of the Trump administration's strike on Venezuelan boats.

item.title: The ongoing U.S.-China trade war has complicated things for U.S. chip giant Nvidia
item.description: U.S. chip giant Nvidia is caught in the middle of the U.S.-China trade war. But it will take more than geopolitical tensions to rein in demand for the company's chips.

item.title: 'Bojack Horseman' creator Raphael Bob-Waksberg says childhood boredom shaped his comedy
item.description: On Wild Card, guests answer the kinds of questions we often don't talk about. Long Story Short and Bojack Horseman creator Raphael Bob-Waksberg reflects on how childhood boredom shaped his comedy.

item.title: Utah's Gov. Cox and 'Disagree Better' are in the spotlight after Kirk killing
item.description: As Utah Gov. Spencer Cox takes center stage in the investigation of Charlie Kirk's assassination, the future of his "Disagree Better" approach is uncertain and could be up to the voters.

item.title: In Jordan, inventors try to make Gaza air drops less deadly
item.description: Amid obstacles in getting food to Gaza, a U.S. aid group tests new ideas for non-lethal ways of dropping aid.

item.title: Trump moves to scrub national parks sites of signs that cast America in a 'negative light'
item.description: The National Park Service faced a deadline this week to address signs that "inappropriately disparage" historical figures. One target is George Washington's house in Philadelphia, where he held enslaved people.

item.title: Trump gets pomp and pageantry upon his arrival to the U.K.
item.description: Red carpets, carriage processions, military parades and an 11th century castle: President Trump basked in royal pomp and pageantry with King Charles ahead of his summit Thursday with PM Starmer.

item.title: Trump arrives in the U.K. The reaction, like America, is divided
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Member of Parliament Ed Davey about his decision to boycott the state dinner with President Trump.
